page.title: 07Farming 1 - Little Bottom Fm
page.content: Little Bottom Farm is situated \ mile south of Wrenrhyeolydd. As we arrived in the farmyard we were greeted by 3 snarling sheep dogs and an array of panic stricken chickens. Bottom Farm has 150 acres of land and is mainly concerned with sheep and beef cattle. But htey are very proud of their 5 acres of orchards. They have 450 apple trees and some plum trees. The cider apples are havested around August-September and sold to Bulmers cider factory in Hereford. The farmers wife estimated that 2 tons of cider apples are picked each year from the old trees. They have just planted 250 young trees. In a barn by the yard we were shown the farmer's hobby- peacocks. They had 4 hens and 3 cocks, all of them just 1 year old. A full grown cock was strutting about the farm grounds.
